definition: to run this way and that (idiom); to rush about busily/to bustle about
surname Dong
east/host (i.e. sitting on east side of guest)/landlord
to hurry/to rush/to run quickly/to elope
to go to/to head for/towards
(used in given names)/variant of 奔[ben1]
variant of 奔[ben1]/variant of 奔[ben4]
west
the West/abbr. for Spain 西班牙[Xi1 ban1 ya2]/Spanish
(of an animal) to paw (the ground)
to run/to run away/to escape/to run around (on errands etc)/(of a gas or liquid) to leak or evaporate/(verb complement) away/off

sentences.english: The children were tearing around in the park.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们在公园里东奔西跑。

sentences.english: I was exhausted after buzzing around for a whole day.
sentences.chinese: 一整天东奔西跑的，把我累坏了。

sentences.english: The boy was running around with a chip on his shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 这男孩东奔西跑，到处游逛，摆出一副好斗的姿态。

sentences.english: The general manager has been batting around all day talking with every guest.
sentences.chinese: 总经理整天东奔西跑，与每位宾客谈话。

sentences.english: I don't feel energetic enough to rush about, so I'll sit down.
sentences.chinese: 我感到没有力气东奔西跑，所以要坐下来。

sentences.english: Those who couldn’t afford to would run around to other factories looking for work.
sentences.chinese: 那些无以为继的，就东奔西跑地到别的工厂找工作。

sentences.english: Aircraft in the field love to run around, worked up quickly, but can not relax.
sentences.chinese: 飞机在情场中东奔西跑，动情快，但也放不开。

sentences.english: The best part of his job is all the travel it includes.
sentences.chinese: 他的工作大部分是东奔西跑，到处出差。

definition: to run this way and that (idiom); to rush about busily/to bustle about/to hopscotch/also 東跑西顛|东跑西颠[dong1 pao3 xi1 dian1]
to rush about/to be constantly on the move
to tax one's mind and body/demanding (work)/dedicated (worker)/hard-working
to be busy rushing about/to bustle about
day and night/regardless of the time of day or night
to feel apprehensive/to be alarmed
see 起早貪黑|起早贪黑[qi3 zao3 tan1 hei1]
(idiom) terribly busy/up to one's ears in work
to leave early and return late (idiom)
to be industrious, rising early and going to bed late
to rush about on errands/to be kept on the run
to work with one's brains/to rack one's brains/to worry
to be a tax on (one's mind)/to bother/to trouble/to be concerned
to tire oneself out through overwork/to work oneself to death
to have difficulty getting by/to struggle (financially etc)
to work hard/to look after
